intro: Anisocycla blepharosepala, commonly known as the broad-leafed anisocycla, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its compound umbels of small white flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic and can be used in traditional herbal remedies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and pollinator support.
